trans-unit.source: Add a certificate to the Java CA store | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add a certificate to the Java CA store | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add a certificate authority (CA) certificate to the Java CA certificate (cacerts) store for Twilio service or Azure Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add a certificate authority (CA) certificate to the Java CA certificate (cacerts) store for Twilio service or Azure Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: Adding a Certificate to the Java CA Certificates Store
trans-unit.target: Adding a Certificate to the Java CA Certificates Store

trans-unit.source: The following steps show you how to add a certificate authority (CA) certificate to the Java CA certificate (cacerts) store.
trans-unit.target: The following steps show you how to add a certificate authority (CA) certificate to the Java CA certificate (cacerts) store.

trans-unit.source: The example used is for the CA certificate required by the Twilio service.
trans-unit.target: The example used is for the CA certificate required by the Twilio service.

trans-unit.source: Information provided later in the topic describes how to install the CA certificate for the Azure Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: Information provided later in the topic describes how to install the CA certificate for the Azure Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: You can use keytool to add the CA certificate prior to zipping your JDK and adding it to your Azure project's **approot** folder, or you could run an Azure start-up task that uses keytool to add the certificate.
trans-unit.target: You can use keytool to add the CA certificate prior to zipping your JDK and adding it to your Azure project's **approot** folder, or you could run an Azure start-up task that uses keytool to add the certificate.

trans-unit.source: This example assumes you will add a CA certificate prior to the JDK being zipped.
trans-unit.target: This example assumes you will add a CA certificate prior to the JDK being zipped.

trans-unit.source: Also, a specific CA certificate will be used in the example, but the steps of obtaining a different CA certificate and importing it into the cacerts store would be similar.
trans-unit.target: Also, a specific CA certificate will be used in the example, but the steps of obtaining a different CA certificate and importing it into the cacerts store would be similar.

trans-unit.source: To add a certificate to the cacerts store
trans-unit.target: To add a certificate to the cacerts store

trans-unit.source: At a command prompt that is set to your JDK's **jdk\jre\lib\security** folder, run the following to see what certificates are installed:
trans-unit.target: At a command prompt that is set to your JDK's **jdk\jre\lib\security** folder, run the following to see what certificates are installed:

trans-unit.source: You'll be prompted for the store password.
trans-unit.target: You'll be prompted for the store password.

trans-unit.source: The default password is **changeit**.
trans-unit.target: The default password is **changeit**.

trans-unit.source: (If you want to change the password, see the keytool documentation at <http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/keytool.html>.) This example assumes that the certificate with MD5 fingerprint 67:CB:9D:C0:13:24:8A:82:9B:B2:17:1E:D1:1B:EC:D4 is not listed, and that you want to import it (this particular certificate is needed by the Twilio API service).
trans-unit.target: (If you want to change the password, see the keytool documentation at <http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/keytool.html>.) This example assumes that the certificate with MD5 fingerprint 67:CB:9D:C0:13:24:8A:82:9B:B2:17:1E:D1:1B:EC:D4 is not listed, and that you want to import it (this particular certificate is needed by the Twilio API service).

trans-unit.source: Obtain the certificate from the list of certificates listed at [GeoTrust Root Certificates](http://www.geotrust.com/resources/root-certificates/).
trans-unit.target: Obtain the certificate from the list of certificates listed at [GeoTrust Root Certificates](http://www.geotrust.com/resources/root-certificates/).

trans-unit.source: Right-click the link for the certificate with serial number 35:DE:F4:CF and save it to the **jdk\jre\lib\security** folder.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the link for the certificate with serial number 35:DE:F4:CF and save it to the **jdk\jre\lib\security** folder.

trans-unit.source: For purposes of this example, it was saved to a file named **Equifax\_Secure\_Certificate\_Authority.cer**.
trans-unit.target: For purposes of this example, it was saved to a file named **Equifax\_Secure\_Certificate\_Authority.cer**.

trans-unit.source: Import the certificate via the following command:
trans-unit.target: Import the certificate via the following command:

trans-unit.source: When prompted to trust this certificate, if the certificate has MD5 fingerprint 67:CB:9D:C0:13:24:8A:82:9B:B2:17:1E:D1:1B:EC:D4, respond by typing **y**.
trans-unit.target: When prompted to trust this certificate, if the certificate has MD5 fingerprint 67:CB:9D:C0:13:24:8A:82:9B:B2:17:1E:D1:1B:EC:D4, respond by typing **y**.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to ensure the CA certificate has been successfully imported:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to ensure the CA certificate has been successfully imported:

trans-unit.source: Zip the JDK and add it to your Azure project's **approot** folder.
trans-unit.target: Zip the JDK and add it to your Azure project's **approot** folder.

trans-unit.source: For information about keytool, see <http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/keytool.html>.
trans-unit.target: For information about keytool, see <http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/keytool.html>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Root Certificates
trans-unit.target: Azure Root Certificates

trans-unit.source: Your applications that use Azure services (such as Azure Service Bus) need to trust the Baltimore CyberTrust Root certificate.
trans-unit.target: Your applications that use Azure services (such as Azure Service Bus) need to trust the Baltimore CyberTrust Root certificate.

trans-unit.source: (Beginning April 15, 2013, Azure began migrating from the GTE CyberTrust Global Root to the Baltimore CyberTrust Root.
trans-unit.target: (Beginning April 15, 2013, Azure began migrating from the GTE CyberTrust Global Root to the Baltimore CyberTrust Root.

trans-unit.source: This migration took several months to complete.)
trans-unit.target: This migration took several months to complete.)

trans-unit.source: The Baltimore certificate might already be installed in your cacerts store, so remember to run the **keytool -list** command first to see if it already exists.
trans-unit.target: The Baltimore certificate might already be installed in your cacerts store, so remember to run the **keytool -list** command first to see if it already exists.

trans-unit.source: If you need to add the Baltimore CyberTrust Root, it has serial number 02:00:00:b9 and SHA1 fingerprint d4:de:20:d0:5e:66:fc:53:fe:1a:50:88:2c:78:db:28:52:ca:e4:74.
trans-unit.target: If you need to add the Baltimore CyberTrust Root, it has serial number 02:00:00:b9 and SHA1 fingerprint d4:de:20:d0:5e:66:fc:53:fe:1a:50:88:2c:78:db:28:52:ca:e4:74.

trans-unit.source: It can be downloaded from <https://cacert.omniroot.com/bc2025.crt>, saved to a local file with extension **.cer**, and then imported using **keytool** as shown above.
trans-unit.target: It can be downloaded from <https://cacert.omniroot.com/bc2025.crt>, saved to a local file with extension **.cer**, and then imported using **keytool** as shown above.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the root certificates used by Azure, see [Azure Root Certificate Migration](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazure/archive/2013/03/15/windows-azure-root-certificate-migration.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the root certificates used by Azure, see [Azure Root Certificate Migration](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazure/archive/2013/03/15/windows-azure-root-certificate-migration.aspx).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
